summary: Expense tracking app UI with sidebar navigation, including History and Regular Expense features with budgeting, expense logging, and downloadable PDF reports.
architectural_notes: 'History' entry is part of the sidebar navigation.
'Regular Expense' entry/button should be visible on desktop and accessible from the sidebar.
Expense logging fields: date, expense type, amount; support budget setting.
Report download flow: user selects weekly/monthly/yearly range before generating PDF.

existing_features.title: Ensure the desktop sidebar navigation includes a visible, clickable "History" option that navigates to the existing History page/tab.
Add a new "Regular Expense" entry to the desktop sidebar navigation (desktop-only sidebar) that navigates to a new "Regular Expense" tab/page.
Add a desktop-only "Regular Expense" button on the Deskboard page that navigates to the "Regular Expense" tab/page.
Implement the "Regular Expense" page UI that lets an authenticated user (Internet Identity) set a budget and log expenses with date, expense type, amount, and a daily update workflow.
Add PDF download for expense reports where the user can choose report type (weekly, monthly, yearly), and the generated PDF content/format reflects the selected range.

new_feature_requests.summary: Add 'History' option to the sidebar navigation.
Add 'Regular Expense' feature (desktop-visible button and also accessible from sidebar) allowing users to set a budget and log expenses with date, type, and amount.
Enable downloadable expense reports as PDF with user-selectable time range (weekly/monthly/yearly) and formatting based on the selected range.
Add backend persistence for per-user budgets and expense entries, including APIs to save/read the budget, create expense entries, and list expense entries for the caller (authorized users only).

projectName: Add Regular Expense tracking with budget + PDF reports and ensure sidebar access
